column4: whenever I try to launch a second gnome-terminal, it fails to launch. I even try to launch multiple gnome-terminals from xterms, but I can only open one, and the next one just exits without returning any errors, it just fails to launch
I would really like to run more than one gnome-terminal
I like the transparency
upgraded from feisty to gutsy
but it did the same thing just before the upgrade
pastebin strace thecommand
hmm i dont even have gnome terminal on my box
how do I get the output from running that command to go into a text file?
strace has an -o option
the normal < didnt' work
strace -o /tmp/whatever gnome-terminal
strace goes to stderr, which you'd redirect with like 2>/dev/null
http://pastebin.com/m7889a91f
huh
i'm not seeing anything blatantly obvious
thats it failing to start right?
it also seems to leave a running bash shell in the process list every time the terminal fails to launch
that is it failing to start
ususally i have troubles with the terminal program not being able to make a pty
but I'm not seeing that in there, its a screwy issue i've never come across before, only possible lead might be it not finding locale info
do you know where the gnome-terminal config files are located? I am thinking about just deleting them
either something in /etc or a . file in /home/$you
it was something wrong in the config, I deleted the gnome-terminal foler in .gconf and it works fine now ~~~
